This programme is designed for professionals working with children with complex needs within the community and across education
column2: health and social fields. This includes existing teaching assistants and those aspiring to become teaching assistants (including those whose ultimate goal might be qualified teacher status)
column3: key workers in social work environments or health support services
column6: early years and childrens centre workers
column7: extended school providers and staff supporting childrens needs in a range of situations.

column1: The course will support the governments workforce remodelling as classroom assistants
column3: take on an increasingly professional role and seek increased opportunities for professional development. It will support the governments agenda on inclusion and special services.

column1: The course also addresses the Children Bill
column2: which revolutionises the role of those associated with child support as well as the Every Child Matters programme
column3: which seeks to integrate and personalise the education
column4: social and health services supporting children with additional needs.

column1: The programme will be comprised of six (20 credit) modules per year. They will be designed to enable participants to develop their own personal skills (key skills) alongside developing academic skills. The modules cover a wide range of areas directly applicable to working in educational settings. In each year
column2: three core modules must be completed by all participants.

column1: A two-day Foundation Degree Induction Programme before the start of the course is a prerequisite.
